intro: Vella bourgaeana, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, heart-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and bloom throughout the year under suitable conditions. Vella bourgaeana is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
